item.title: Notes: Dijksterhuis. (2006). On Making the Right Choice
item.description: References Citekey: @Dijksterhuis2006 Dijksterhuis, A. (2006). On Making the Right Choice: The Deliberation-Without-Attention Effect. Science, 311(5763), 1005â€“1007. doi:10.1126/science.1121629 Notes A nice article reporting on four studies on the “Deliberation-Without-Attention” hypothesis; that is, simple choices (such as between different towels or different sets of oven mitts) indeed produce better results after conscious thought, but that choices in complex matters (such as between different houses or different cars) should be left to unconscious thought.
